pull.title: guix: use GCC 11 in macOS build env
pull.body:
Note that this is just the native compiler, which is used to build the toolchain we use to build the actual binaries.

Partially motivated by #29091, where it could now be a bit confusing if we are explicitly using GCC 10 in our release toolchain, when our minimum required is 11 (this can't be bumped to 12 due to build issues with native tools).

At the same time, remove `gcc-toolchain "static"` from the macOS build env.

guix: use GCC 11 for macOS builds

Note that this is just the native compiler, that is used to build the
toolchain we use to build the actual binaries.

Partially motivated by 29091.

events.message:
guix: use GCC 11 for macOS builds

Note that this is just the native compiler, that is used to build the
toolchain we use to build the actual binaries.

Partially motivated by 29091.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -70,12 +69,21 @@ unset CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH
 unset OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH
 unset OBJCPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH
 
-export LIBRARY_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/lib:${NATIVE_GCC_STATIC}/lib"
 export C_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 export CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 export OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 export OBJCPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 
+case "$HOST" in
+    *darwin*)
+        export LIBRARY_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/lib"
comments.body: Is it a good place to move `export OBJ{C,CPLUS}_INCLUDE_PATH` commands here?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -70,12 +69,21 @@ unset CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH
 unset OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH
 unset OBJCPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH
 
-export LIBRARY_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/lib:${NATIVE_GCC_STATIC}/lib"
 export C_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 export CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 export OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 export OBJCPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 
+case "$HOST" in
+    *darwin*)
+        export LIBRARY_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/lib"
comments.body: Given these are standard ENV vars supported by both compilers, I'm pretty happy to just leave them where they are.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -70,12 +69,21 @@ unset CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH
 unset OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH
 unset OBJCPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH
 
-export LIBRARY_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/lib:${NATIVE_GCC_STATIC}/lib"
 export C_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 export CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 export OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 export OBJCPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 
+case "$HOST" in
+    *darwin*)
+        export LIBRARY_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/lib"
comments.body:
Right. But it seems a bit inconsistent. This PR skips static GCC toolchain directory in `LIBRARY_PATH` for the macOS hosts because it is _never_ used there, right. And Objective C/C++ paths are used _only_ for macOS hosts.

Anyway, I'm fine with this PR as it is.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -70,12 +69,21 @@ unset CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH
 unset OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH
 unset OBJCPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH
 
-export LIBRARY_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/lib:${NATIVE_GCC_STATIC}/lib"
 export C_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 export CPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 export OBJC_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 export OBJCPLUS_INCLUDE_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/include/c++:${NATIVE_GCC}/include"
 
+case "$HOST" in
+    *darwin*)
+        export LIBRARY_PATH="${NATIVE_GCC}/lib"
comments.body:
> This PR skips static GCC toolchain directory in LIBRARY_PATH for the macOS hosts because it is never used there, right.

It's skiping it because its no-longer available, and checks in our Guix script would fail if we didn't change this. The same is not currently true for the compiler lang env vars. We'll move forward here, and refactor this further when switching to LLD.
